description: Erection of 3 storey roof extension to the existing 5 storey building including a new lift/stair core and external fire escape in connection with the provision of 66 new ensuite study bedrooms with shared kitchen accommodation (Sui Generis Use Class - student accommodation).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - Sample panels of all the external facing materials including the brick facing materials, window reveals, glazing, and cladding shall be provided on site and approved by the Council before the relevant parts of the works are commenced and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approval given. A sample materials board shall be erected on site for inspection by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and S1 and B1 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 3 - Prior to the commencement of any development hereby permitted, a sustainability appraisal shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The appraisal shall be in the form of a BREEAM to meet a 'very good' standard. Thereafter, the building shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with the agreed details.

Reason: To ensure that the development is sustainable in accordance with the requirements of policy EN12 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and to policy SD9 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 4 - The additional bicycle storage shown on the approved drawings shall be retained and used for no other purpose other than for the storage of bicycles for users of the development.

Reason: In order to satisfactorily provide suitable storage for bicycles in accordance with policy TR22 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policy T3 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 5 - Before the use commences, details of the method of storage and waste removal including recycled materials shall be submitted to and approved by the Council and the approved method shall thereafter be maintained.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies SD6, B1 and B7 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of any development hereby permitted an appraisal incorporating biodiversity enhancement measures shall be submitted to an approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Thereafter, the building shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with the agreed details.

Reason: To ensure that the development is sustainable in accordance with the requirements of policy EN12 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and to policy SD9 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 7 - Before the development commences details shall be submitted of two additional rooms suitable for occupation by wheelchair users so that a total of 7 such rooms are provided instead of the 5 originally proposed. These rooms shall be provided and available for occupation before the additional accommodation within the extension hereby approved is occupied, and they shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In order to ensure there is an adequate provision of rooms suitable for occupation by wheelchair users and in order to meet the requirements of policy H7 of the Revised Deposit Draft of the Replacement Unitary Development Plan as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
 
Condition : 8 - No construction shall take place until a detailed design and method statement for all foundations and other development proposed below ground level which takes account of the proposed running tunnels of the Cross Rail Project including any ground movements arising from the construction of the Cross Rail tunnels, has been submitted to and approved by the Council.

Reason: So that the Council [and the Cross Rail Project Team] may be satisfied that the proposed Crossrail Project is adequately safeguarded, in accordance with the requirements of policy T4 and as set out in TP2 of the Schedule of Transport Proposals,  of the London Borough of Camden replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
